file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-60-05-04 - TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. The temperature control module is installed in the cockpit, below the RH lateral console lining. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - ALL 21-60-05-000-801-A REMOVAL TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - IN- ALL 21-60-05-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-60-05 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-60-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the temperature control module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 224 224FRW RH lateral console of the cockpit 224 224KRW RH lateral console of the cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the PACK 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (2) Open access panels 224FRW and 224KRW ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector. (2) Remove the screws and the washers. (3) Remove the temperature control module. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-60-05 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Temperature Control Module - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 224 DET. A TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE B C DET. C DET. B 145AMM210039.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-60-05 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-60-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. TEMPERATURE CONTROL MODULE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the temperature control module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION TEMPERATURE CONTROL SYSTEM - OPERATION- AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500 AL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 224 224FRW RH lateral console of the cockpit 224 224KRW RH lateral console of the cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the PACK 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the temperature control module in the installation position. (2) Install the washers and the screws. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 21-60-05 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Connect the electrical connector. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access panels 224FRW and 224KRW ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Remove the tag and close the PACK 1 circuit breaker. (3) Do the Temperature Control System - Operational Check ( AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500).
